abstract: In the second of three articles, the works of Madison and Hamilton, from The Federalist Papers through the bank bill debate, and continuing with Madisons post-1817 works are surveyed. The survey covers 151 works (essays, speeches and letters) over 49 years which consist of 265,859 words. The results count 41 uses of exigencies (and its affiliate exigency) in these works.
title: Hamilton and Madison Deploy Exigencies In Works Dated to 1787/88, 1790/91 and 1817-1836
subject: law
